extendedIngredients.name: broccoli rabe
extendedIngredients.original: 1 bunch broccoli rabe, ends trimmed and stalks cut into 1-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: broccoli rabe, ends trimmed and stalks cut into 1-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: fresh corn kernels
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup corn kernels, fresh (from 2 ears) or frozen
extendedIngredients.originalName: corn kernels, fresh (from 2 ears) or frozen

title: Linguine with Broccoli Rabe, Bacon, and Corn
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Linguine with Broccoli Rabe, Bacon, and Corn a try. This recipe makes 4 servings with 620 calories, 26g of protein, and 15g of fat each. For $1.84 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. If you have kosher salt, linguine, corn kernels, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is good. Try Linguine with Broccoli Rabe-Walnut Pesto, Linguine With Walnut & Broccoli Rabe Pesto, and Chickpeas with Broccoli Rabe and Bacon for similar recipes.
instructions: Cook the linguine according to the package directions. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, over medium heat, fry the bacon until crisp, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel. Spoon off all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings from the pan, reserving the rest.Return pan to medium heat, add the garlic and broccoli rabe, and toss. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the broccoli rabe is tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in the corn, either the reserved bacon drippings or the butter, the salt, and pepper. Add the drained linguine and toss. Heat until warmed through, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with the Parmesan and reserved bacon and toss.Tip: Broccoli rabe has a bitter flavor that many people find pleasing. If you're not one of them, use a 5-ounce bag of fresh spinach instead. Add it to the pan, one handful at a time, along with the linguine.

steps.step: Cook the linguine according to the package directions. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, over medium heat, fry the bacon until crisp, about 4 minutes.
Transfer to a paper towel. Spoon off all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings from the pan, reserving the rest.Return pan to medium heat, add the garlic and broccoli rabe, and toss.

Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the broccoli rabe is tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in the corn, either the reserved bacon drippings or the butter, the salt, and pepper.
Add the drained linguine and toss.
Heat until warmed through, about 3 minutes.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan and reserved bacon and toss.Tip: Broccoli rabe has a bitter flavor that many people find pleasing. If you're not one of them, use a 5-ounce bag of fresh spinach instead.
Add it to the pan, one handful at a time, along with the linguine.
